ingredients.item: 175ml of essential Waitrose Long Life Unsweetened Soya Milk, plus 3 tbsp
tsp juice of an essential Waitrose Lemon
3 tablespoons of the essential Waitrose Canned Chickpea liquid
140ml essential Waitrose Olive Oil + extra for greasing the muffin tins
100g Cooks' Ingredients 70% Dark Chocolate (grated), or 100g essential Waitrose Porridge Oats
2 tsp juice of an essential Waitrose lemon
Tiny bit of the juice of 2 squashed raspberries for colour

instructions.step: Preheat the oven to 200C. Take a 12-cup muffin tin and grease with oil or line with muffin cases. Set aside.

In a little bowl mix together 175ml milk and the lemon juice. Set aside for at least 5 minutes. In a larger bowl mix together the rest of the wet ingredients: the oil, 3 tablespoons of milk and the berries. Combine and set aside.

Next, in another larger bowl mix together the dry ingredients: the flour, baking powder, sugar and chocolate or oats. Then add the wet ingredients, including the milk/lemon mixture and mix until just combined. Evenly distribute into the prepared muffin tin.
Bake for about 20 minutes until the tops are golden. Allow the muffins to cool on a wire rack.
While they are cooling, prepare the glaze (if using) by combining the lemon juice and icing sugar. To add colour, use the juice of 2 mashed raspberries. Drizzle over the muffins and enjoy!
